title: How to Make a Chinese Spiral

steps.headline: Paint the popsicle sticks.
steps.description: It is up to you on how long you want your spiral to be and the colors you want for it. You can either do a mix of colors or a degrade or fade from one color to the next. The image provided shows a degrade from green to yellow.

steps.description: Dab some instant glue on a popsicle stick.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e9\/Spiral_3_260.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e9\/Spiral_3_260.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":347,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":573.8,"licensing":"

steps.description: Place another popsicle stick on top of the glued one. You want to make it a little "off-sided" so that the ends are right next to instead of being on top of each other.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/58\/Spiral_4_658.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/58\/Spiral_4_658.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.2,"licensing":"

steps.description: Make each stack with 3 sticks each. Take one stack of 3 and continue gluing stacks together, using the same gluing method as before.

steps.description: Place a nail on the top being very careful in not destroying the spiral in the process. Tie a piece of lengthy thread on the nail.

text:
